title: Bernie Sanders Joins United Auto Workers' Picket Line Outside Detroit General Motors Plant
text:
Democratic presidential candidate Sen Bernie Sanders joined members of the United Auto Workers union in a picket line outside General Motors’ Detroit-Hamtramck Assembly plant in Detroit, Michigan, on September 25.

Sanders held a “UAW on strike” sign and walked with picketers before giving a short speech in which he urged large companies such as GM to “pay your workers a decent wage” and to stop outsourcing jobs overseas, The Detroit News reported.

“How to not get a federal contract in a Sanders administration,” Sanders tweeted on Wednesday, with bullet points including “Pay workers poverty wages,” “Deny good benefits,” and “Engage in union busting.”

Presidential hopefuls Sen Elizabeth Warren and Sen Amy Klobuchar also visited the Detroit picket line. The strike began September 16.

As of writing, UAW representatives and General Motors continued to negotiate pay increases and benefits for temporary workers, among other issues. Credit: Hilary Golston via Storyful
